Example.Title: ListCameras
Example.Description: Console application to list cameras currently connected to the system.

Example.Title: ActionCommands
Example.Description: Application showing how to use Action Commands and trigger FrameStart of any camera.

Example.Title: ListFeatures
Example.Description: Console application to list features of a given camera.

Example.Title: SynchronousGrab
Example.Description: Console application showing how to grab an image synchronously from a given camera.

Example.Title: AsynchronousGrab
Example.Description: Application showing how to use callbacks (observers) to receive images asynchronously from a given camera. To stop the example press Enter.

Example.Title: AsynchronousGrabOpenCV
Example.Description: Application showing how to use callbacks (observers) to receive images asynchronously from a given camera and display them using OpenCV. To stop the example press Enter.

Example.Title: MultithreadingOpenCV
Example.Description: Console Application that opens all available cameras and displays them with OpenCV. This demonstrates the use of multithreading to acquire images from multiple devices.

Example.Title: ListAncillaryDataFeatures
Example.Description: Console application to list all features of the ancillary data.

Example.Title: EventHandling
Example.Description: Console application to notify on camera events.

Example.Title: CreateTraceLog
Example.Description: This file demonstrates how to enable trace logging for vimba.

Example.Title: LoadSaveSettings
Example.Description:
This example demonstrates
  • storing the current settings of a given camera into an XML string and
  • restoring the camera settings from an XML string.

Example.Title: UserSet
Example.Description: This example demonstrates the user set feature of a given camera.
